msContents.summary: Text outlining the conclusion of the rites (vrata) of the Daśarathalalitāvrata dedicated to the worship of the Hindu god Gaṇeśa, the elephant-headed deity, beginning on the 4th day in the month of Āśvin (September-October), to be performed by a Brahman priest along with his wife. Includes offerings of sweetmeats (laḍḍu and modaka), mantras and other rites associated with pūja.
